perturbation.changed_text: 11.2     It is PPG SHANGHAI's responsibility to ensure that mis-delivery of Product is kept to the minimum. DISTRIBUTOR shall inspect the Products within 12 hours upon delivery. In case of discrepancy found in Products delivered, DISTRIBUTOR shall report to PPG SHANGHAI in writing, detailing all the discrepancies within 12 hours after delivery. PPG SHANGHAI will not accept any claims for discrepancy in delivery beyond the 12 hours period. If Products are found damaged upon delivery, DISTRIBUTOR or its customers who directly receive the delivery shall report to PPG SHANGHAI in writing within 12 hours. The necessary and sufficient evidence (and photos) required for insurance claim must be submitted altogether. None of the damaged Products shall be disposed of until the claim is settled by the insurance company or PPG SHANGHAI.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the inspection and reporting timeframe to 12 hours is unreasonable and potentially violates Article 154 of the Contract Law of the People's Republic of China which requires a reasonable period for inspection based on the nature of the goods.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law of the People's Republic of China, Article 157

perturbation.original_text: 19.1     If either party be in default with respect to any of the terms or          conditions of this Agreement, including, without limitation,          DISTRIBUTOR's failure to pay any invoice of PPG SHANGHAI in accordance          with its terms, and if it fails to correct such default or failure          within ten (10) business days following written notice thereof from the          other, the party serving such notice may, without prejudice to any          other right or remedy, defer further performance hereunder until such          default be remedied or terminate this Agreement by written notice to          the other, and the same shall terminate immediately upon the giving of          such notice.
perturbation.changed_text: 19.1     If either party be in default with respect to any of the terms or conditions of this Agreement, including, without limitation, DISTRIBUTOR's failure to pay any invoice of PPG SHANGHAI in accordance with its terms, and if it fails to correct such default or failure within three (3) business days following written notice thereof from the other, the party serving such notice may, without prejudice to any other right or remedy, defer further performance hereunder until such default be remedied or terminate this Agreement by written notice to the other, and the same shall terminate immediately upon the giving of such notice.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period for default to three business days may be considered unreasonably short under Chinese law, potentially violating principles of fairness and good faith, which is required by Article 6 of the Contract Law of the People's Republic of China.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law of the People's Republic of China, Article 6

perturbation.changed_text: 20.1     All disputes, controversies and claims arising from or incidental to this Agreement shall be resolved by both parties through friendly consultation. If no resolution can be reached within five (5) days following the date on which one party informed the other party his intention to refer the disputes, controversies and claims for arbitration, such disputes, controversies and claims shall be referred to the China International Economic and Trade Arbitration Committee ("Arbitration Committee") for a final and binding arbitration in pursuance to the arbitration rules which is effective on the date hereof.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the period for friendly consultation to five days before resorting to arbitration is insufficient under Chinese legal practice which usually requires a reasonable time for dispute resolution.
